result.execSummary:
The defendant David M Valleau was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Felon Possess Firearm [Modifiers: Repeater], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).
  • Theft-Movable Property-(Firearm) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program after serving 1 year of initial confinement

superMiscConds.notes: Pay restitution in the amount of $528.00

BOTH COUNTS: Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank; pay all appropriate costs. Pay all applicable court costs and surcharges including the DNA surcharge and restitution surcharge to be deducted by 25% of prison wages by 11-09-15 or, if not paid, a civil judgment is ordered.
Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms or body armor. Defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant David M Valleau in court with attorney Jeffrey J Guerard.  Defendant David M Valleau in custody.  Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant changes plea to GUILTY as to COUNTS 1 & 2. On motion of the State, Court orders repeater enhancers as to each count dismissed. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms or body armor. Defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  

Statements made as to sentencing.  
AS TO COUNT 1: The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 4 YEARS, with credit for 74 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 2 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 YEARS.  
AS TO COUNT 2: The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 2 YEARS CONCURRENT TO COUNT 1; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 1 YEAR; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 1 YEAR. 
The defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is eligible for the "Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program" after one year of sentence is served.
Restitution in the amount of $528 to be deducted by 25% of prison wages or by 11.9.15 or, if not paid, a civil judgment is ordered.
Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs to be deducted by 25% of prison wages or by 11.9.15 or, if not paid, a civil judgment is ordered.
Court ordered defendant to pay all applicable court costs and surcharges to be deducted by 25% of prison waged ot by 11.9.15 or, if not paid, a civil judgment is ordered.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored. 

Filed,
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit.

Attorney Jeffrey J Guerard in court, defendant David M Valleau not in court, in custody.  Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 7.   All parties notified as of August 03, 2015 this case is assigned to Judge Rosa, Branch 35, in room 629 of the courthouse.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Jeffrey J Guerard in court, defendant David M Valleau not in court, in custody.  Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 7.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 07-14-2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant David M Valleau in court with attorney Jeffrey J Guerard.  Defendant David M Valleau in custody.  Ronald Dague for Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Thomas McAdams, Branch 07.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 07.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Electronic Monitoring.
Court ordered defendant to be monitored by Drug Testing.
 No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  
Defendant to have no contact with:  Bridget G; Michael S; Brandon S.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant David M Valleau in court with attorney Gregory A. Renden.  Defendant David M Valleau in custody.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge McAdams, Branch 7.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 9, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
